Don't Miss * Important News

*

Don't Miss * Important News *

  • WEATHER NOTICE It is anticipated that conditions will require the City of Grand Saline City Hall to be closed Monday, January 26, 2026. However, the City of Grand Saline follows the Grand Saline ISD CLOSURE schedule for inclement weather. If the school district is closed, then City Hall is closed; if the school district is open, City Hall will be open. Closures are announced through local media outlets such as Channel 7 KLTV, KMOO Radio, and GSISD website and Facebook.

  • CHILI COOK-OFF sponsored by POLICE & FIRE DEPT. COME SHOWCASE YOUR CHILI AT OUR OPEN COMPETITION COOK-OFF.

    Saturday, February 7 - 2:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m. LIVE MUSIC (East Texas Troubadours), FIRE PITS, and HOMEMADE CHILI

    Trophies - Cash Prizes $10 Donation to Taste them All

  • There will be a regularly scheduled meeting of the Grand Saline City Council, Tuesday, February 17, 2026, at 6:00 p.m. The January City Council Meeting will be live streamed tonight on our YouTube channel. We invite the public to tune in and stay informed. https://www.youtube.com/@CityOfGrandSaline

  • LOOKING TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE CITY? We have options available to all. Residency within the city limits is not required. Residency requirements are: Be a resident of the city of Grand Saline OR Be a resident of Van Zandt County; OR Reside within 10 miles of the city of Grand Salines boundaries and in a county bordering Van Zandt County.

    • The Economic Development Corporation (EDC) Board is seeking to appoint new board members.

    • The Parks & Recreation Board is seeking to appoint new board members.

    • The Planning and Zoning Board is seeking to appoint a new board member.

      • Click Application for Board or Committee Positions to fill out application.

  • DID YOU KNOW YOU CAN REGISTER YOUR PET WITH THE CITY OF GRAND SALINE? If your dog or cat is ever lost, registration makes it easy to identify the owner and helps prevent your pet from being sent to the Mineola Animal Shelter. Pet registration can save you from costly shelter fees and, most importantly, helps reunite you with your furry friend faster. Registration is available through the Grand Saline Police Department at the low cost of $10.

WELCOME TO

GRAND SALINE, TEXAS
